questions.question: Which sentence is in the right order?

choices.answer: I always run in the morning.
Always I run in the morning.
I run always in the morning.
I run in the morning always.

questions.question: Which sentence is in the right order?

choices.answer: Never he plays soccer.
He plays never soccer.
He plays soccer never.
He never plays soccer.

questions.question: Which sentence is in the right order?

choices.answer: I usually am  tired on Mondays.
I am tired on Mondays usually.
I am usually tired on Mondays.
I am tired usually on Mondays.

questions.question: Which sentence is in the right order?

choices.answer: Sometimes I have dinner out.
I have  dinner out sometimes.
I sometimes have dinner out.
All alternatives are correct.

questions.question: Which sentence is in the right order?

choices.answer: Do you play tennis often?
Do you play often tennis?
All the alternatives are correct.
Do you often play tennis?

questions.question: Which sentence is in the right order?

choices.answer: She is never late for school.
She never is late for school.
Never she is late for school.
She is late for school never.

questions.question: Which sentence is in the right order?

choices.answer: They don't go often to the cinema.
They don't often go to the cinema.
They don't go to the cinema often.
Often they don't go to the cinema.

questions.question: Which sentence is in the right order?

choices.answer: We are happy after a holiday always.
We always are happy after a holiday.
We are always happy after a holiday.
We are happy always after a holiday.

questions.question: Which sentence is in the right order?

choices.answer: I usually sleep late on Saturdays.
I sleep late usually on Saturdays.
I sleep usually late on Saturdays.
I sleep late on Saturdays usually.

questions.question: Which sentence is in the right order?

choices.answer: Our English classes are cool always.
Our English classes are always cool.
Our English classes always are cool.
Always our English classes are cool.
